de.avgl.dmp.converter.functional

Class NodeListOps

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.avgl.dmp.converter.functional.NodeListOps
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<org.w3c.dom.Node>

    public class NodeListOps
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<org.w3c.dom.Node>
    Wrapper class for NodeList, offering a convenient API for iterating over the represented Nodes. The class makes use of the functional interfaces defined in Function1 et al. It implements the iteration and leaves the details of each iteration step at the caller.
    Author:
    Paul Horn

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeListOps

        public NodeListOps(org.w3c.dom.NodeList underlying)
        Class Constructor. Wraps the given NodeList in an ImmutableList, so that the underlying collection can be easily shared and re-used.
        Parameters:
        underlying - the original collection of Nodes

    • Method Detail

      • forEach

        public void forEach(UnitFunction1<org.w3c.dom.Node> fun)
        Iterate over every Node and apply the function fun over it. forEach is the base operation for every other high level iterator method.
        Parameters:
        fun - The function that is applied for its side-effect to every element. The result of function fun is discarded.

      • filter

        public NodeListOps filter(Function1<org.w3c.dom.Node,java.lang.Boolean> pred)
        Selects all elements of this collection which satisfy a predicate.
        Parameters:
        pred - the predicate used to test elements.
        Returns:
        a new NodeListOps consisting of all elements of this collection that satisfy the given predicate pred.

      • map

        public <T> java.util.List<T> map(Function1<org.w3c.dom.Node,T> fun)
        Builds a new collection by applying a function to all elements of this collection.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type of the returned collection.
        Parameters:
        fun - the function to apply to each element.
        Returns:
        a new collection resulting from applying the given function f to each element of this collection and collecting the results.

      • get

        public java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Node> get()
        Expose the underlying collection. Since this is an immutable collection, this can be shared freely without having to make defensive copies.
        Returns:
        the current collection

        Parameters:
        idx - the element index, 0-based.
        Returns:

      • getElementsByTagName

        public java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Node> getElementsByTagName(java.lang.String tagName)
        Shortcut for filtering all Nodes, that match a given tag name.
        Parameters:
        tagName - the tag name to filter for
        Returns:
        a new collection consisting only of Nodes, that match the given tag name

        public java.lang.String getTextContent(java.lang.String nodeName)

        Returns:
